acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 48-hour EC50=0.0146ppm of EC of Crustacea (Daphnia magna) (AQUIRE, 2003).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: The purity reduced values of LD50 values are rabbit 107.2mg/kg (=134*0.8) and rat 157.5mg/kg (=315*0.5) of IUCLID (2000).  High purity with high toxicity of 107.2mg/kg was adopted, and it was set as Category 2.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Since there are two rat LC50 values: 0.23mg/L (the original is 230mg/m3) (RTECS (2003)) and purity equivalent 0.235mg/L (=0.29*0.809) (IUCLID (2000)), 0.23mg/L of higher toxicity was adopted and set to category 2.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale:
No data.
(It is a solid. But there is no vapor pressure information, and it is unknown whether exposure to vapor is possible.)

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: We had two LD50 values in rats, 350mg/kg and 165mg/kg (RTECS(2003)), so we adopted 165mg/kg which is the higher toxicity value, and classified the substance as Category 3.

carcinogenicity.rationale: Based on the classification (Group 3) in IARC52 (1991) and (D) in IRIS (2000), it was out of the Category.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 1, since acute toxicity was Category 1, and behavior in water and bioaccumulative potential are unknown.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available.

explosives.rationale: Not classified based on UNRTDG No. 1496, Class: 5.1, PGIII, though containing O-Halogen bonds as chemical groups associated with explosive properties present.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: It was set as Category 2 from the positive example (oral administration negative) by the medication in the abdominal cavity in the in vivo small core examination of a mouse (IARC52 (1991), IRIS (2000)).

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: From the description in rat and mouse "the slightly impact on reproductive was observed"(IARC52 (1991)), it is thought that reproductive toxicity is slight, and  in the report of the rabbit of ATSDR (2004), some findings are observed but it does not think that it relate to administration directly, in addition,  there was description that "there was no evidence of reproductive toxicity" in rat (JAT (2000) (RTECS (2003) original literature of prescription data), it carried out the outside of Category.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale:
There is the descriptions in human effects (having irritation) (ICSC(J)(2000), HSFS(2000), HSDB(2002)), and two data in rabit (having irritation) (IUCLID(2000)), it is clear its irritation. Since the examination data used as the index of subdivision was not found in IUCLID, it was classified into Category 2A-2B.
[Indication] 2A is recommended based on the safety, when the Category needs to subdivide.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: The data (which is weak stimulative) of ECETOC TR66 (1995) in the rabbit corresponds to category 3. But it was set as category 2 since comparatively stronger stimulativeness could be considered from "a stimulus and chemical burn" (HSFS (2000)) and "a strong stimulative" (HSDB (2002)) in the human impact.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Stable to water (the water solubility is obtained)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (heart, blood)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 (heart, blood) based on the description of ATSDR (2004)(Priority 1) (influence on the significant blood in administration) and the description of RTECS (2003)(Priority 2) (cardiomyopathy) in rat, and the dose of each toxic view.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (respiratory system, kidney)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: The substance was classified as Category 2 (respiratory system, kidneys) because of the reports of the effects (cyanosis resulting from the effects on the respiratory system, renal failure) on humans in RTECS (2003), in Priority 2, and of pulmonary edema, dyspnea and airway irritant properties in HSFS (2000), and of airway irritant properties in ICSC (J) (2000).
